content:
When building my IG, I get this warning: 

OperationDefinition: opd-0: 'Name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation' Rule 'Name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation' Failed

In this instance the Operation is named ( publisher complained about all 3 operation names defined in the IG):

CarePlan-Recommendations

Where is the Guideline for how an Operation should be named? CarePlan-Recommendations seems machine processable....
They don't like dashes in names. I throw those in my ignored warnings file.
Richard Braman (FLY.HEALTH) has marked this topic as resolved.
@David Pyke Why would you ignore that? Computable names should be computable - which means no dashes. The 'title' element is where you put the human-friendly names. FMG won't let you ignore those
